content.eamr: ( ing-10 "1/2 cup chopped walnuts or pecans" )

content.text: 0) In a large mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "combine"@27:34 / AC
		:ppt ( "the first six ingredients"@35:60 / FOOD
			:ref ( ing-0 )
			:ref ( ing-1 )
			:ref ( ing-2 )
			:ref ( ing-3 )
			:ref ( ing-4 )
			:ref ( ing-5 )
		)
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a large mixing bowl"@6:25 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Combine the applesauce, oil and eggs.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
	:inform ( ac-1-0 "Combine"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "the applesauce"@11:25 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "oil"@27:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-8 "eggs"@35:39 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 2) Add to the flour mixture; mix well.
3) Stir in the chocolate chip and walnuts.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-9 "the chocolate chip"@11:29 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "walnuts"@34:41 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 in apart onto baking sheets coated with nonstick cooking spray.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "Drop"@3:7 / AC
		:instrument ( tool-4-0 "rounded teaspoonfuls"@11:31 / TOOL )
		:gol ( tool-4-1 "baking sheets"@48:61 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Flatten slightly with a glass bottom coated with nonstick cooking spray.
6) Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "Bake"@3:7 / AC
		:heat ( temp-6-0 "350 degrees F"@11:24 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-6-0 "10-12 minutes"@29:42 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-6-0 "until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set"@46:97 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Cool for 1 minute before removing to wire racks.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "Cool"@3:7 / AC
		:duration ( dur-7-0 "1 minute"@12:20 / DUR )
		:duration ( cond-7-0 "before removing to wire racks"@21:50 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)
